fields.value: Replication Data for: Relevance propagation Results with Bag of Words Classifiers as used in  "On Pixel-wise Explanations for Non-Linear Classifier Decisions by Layer-wise Relevance Propaganda"

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This data set contains all the example images showing round shapes and polygons  and labels as used in the manuscript
"On Pixel-wise Explanations for Non-Linear Classifier Decisions by Layer-wise Relevance Propaganda" submitted to PLOS ONE (PONE-D-14-2011) for demonstrating Layer-wise Relevance Propagation with support vector machines over Bag of Words representations.

publicationCitation.value: Bach S, Binder A, Montavon G, Klauschen F, MÃ¼ller K-R, Samek W (2015) On Pixel-Wise Explanations for Non-Linear Classifier Decisions by Layer-Wise Relevance Propagation. PLoS ONE 10(7): e0130140. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0130140

fields.value:
The data set contains training and test data, as used in the manuscript mentioned above.

polygonsTrain contains the training data
polygonsTestNoBackground is the test data

both the training and test data contain several larger images showing the raw data, and folders "images" and "labels". the sub-folder "images" contains tiles cropped from the larger images at locations 34 pixels apart. each tile has a side length of 102 pixels and are named according to the image file they originate from:

<source_image_name>_ts<sidelength>_tile<XXYY>.png

where sidelength is 102 over all the files
XX indicates the horizontal grid position of that image
YY indicates the vertical grid position of that image
The pixel coordinates x0, y0 of the upper left corner of each image tile therefore be inferred as:
x0 = 34*XX
y0 = 34*XX

the folder labels contains information about the depicted shapes for each image in folder "images". The naming pattern of those files is in accordance to its partner file in "images" and the name of the source image:

<source_image_name>_ts<sidelength>_tile<XXYY>_info.txt

For each shape within a .png-file in folder "images", of which the center of mass is at least four pixels away from the image border there is a line of text in the corresponding .txt-file in "labels":

YY XX shape

where shape can either be "edges", indicating a polygon with four to eight edges or "round" indicating the presence of a lp-based shape with center of mass at pixel position YY XX
